title: It's bracket time: Make your picks for the men's tournament
content: The bracket is set. Here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: Your guide to all 68 teams in the men’s NCAA tournament
content: The bracket is set, here's everything you need to know about the competitors for this year's national title.

title: Bengals reach extensions with Chase, Higgins
content: The Bengals have secured two of the NFL's most prominent wide receivers, with Ja'Marr Chase and Tee Higgins telling Fox Sports that they have agreed to contract extensions.

title: Auburn, Duke top men's NCAA field; SEC gets 14
content: Overall top seed Auburn was joined by Duke, Houston and Florida as 1-seeds, and a record 14 teams from the SEC were selected to participate in the NCAA tournament.

title: UCLA lands NCAA's No. 1 overall women's seed
content: UCLA, South Carolina and Texas, who all had a turn at No. 1 this season in the Associated Press poll, joined USC on Sunday as the top seeds in the women's NCAA basketball tournament, which will begin this week and conclude with the Final Four in Tampa.

title: Scheyer: Goal for Flagg to play in Friday opener
content: Duke coach Jon Scheyer told ESPN that the goal is for star freshman Cooper Flagg to play in Friday's first-round game following his ankle injury.

title: Betts (illness) out for Tokyo Series; lost 15 pounds
content: Dodgers shortstop Mookie Betts will not play in the two-game Tokyo Series against the Cubs because of an illness that's lingered for the past week.

title: McIlroy, Spaun set for Monday playoff at Players
content: Rory McIlroy and J.J. Spaun wound up tied after a four-hour rain delay Sunday at the Players Championship and have to return Monday for a playoff to decide who wins the richest tournament in golf.

title: Messi back in starting lineup, scores in Miami win
content: Substitute Fafà Picault scored for Inter Miami CF in the 89th minute, and Lionel Messi scored for the first time in the MLS regular season in a dramatic, late 2-1 victory at Atlanta United FC on Sunday.

title: Andreeva stops Sabalenka for Indian Wells title
content: Russian teenager Mirra Andreeva fought back to overcome world No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka 2-6, 6-4, 6-3 in the Indian Wells final Sunday.

title: Lunardi: The one big thing the selection committee got wrong
content: After genuinely consistent selections in the NET era, the committee's decision to include both Texas and North Carolina has stumped our resident Bracketologist.

title: Men's first-round betting odds, lines, spread and BPI
content: Every set of betting lines, spreads, totals and more betting odds for the first round of the 2025 men's NCAA tournament.

title: Destiny's Child's 'Say My Name' leads trends since last time Kansas wasn't a top-four seed in March Madness
content: The Kansas Jayhawks enter the NCAA Tournament seeded outside of the top-four for the first time since 2000.

title: Inside the Western wild-card race
content: The Wild appear locked in to the first spot, but who gets the second? Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: Newcastle beat Liverpool, win first trophy since '69
content: Newcastle United ended a 70-year domestic trophy drought as they beat Liverpool 2-1 to win the Carabao Cup.

title: Guimarães on cup win: 'Best day of my life'
content: Newcastle United captain Bruno Guimarães said it was the best day of his life as they beat Liverpool 2-1 in the Carabao Cup final at Wembley Stadium.

title: Source: Pulisic in talks over new AC Milan deal
content: United States national team star Christian Pulisic is in negotiations with AC Milan over a new contract, a source has told ESPN.

title: Arsenal beat Chelsea; keep alive faint title hopes
content: Arsenal defeated Chelsea 1-0 for their first win in four Premier League games on Sunday to keep their faint Premier League title hopes alive.

title: Palmer set to miss England squad through injury
content: Enzo Maresca expects Cole Palmer to miss England's World Cup qualifiers after suffering a "muscular injury" which will require a scan on Monday.

title: Whitham, 14, becomes youngest player in NWSL
content: McKenna Whitham, 14, became the youngest-ever footballer to play in the NWSL after coming off the bench in NJ/NY Gotham FC's season opener against Seattle Reign.

title: McElhenney lauds Wrexham, Wycombe 'humanity'
content: Rob McElhenney praised a "show of humanity" from supporters after a fan who suffered a medical incident during Saturday's game is now recovering in hospital.

title: Angel City's Leroux takes mental health break
content: Sydney Leroux has said she will take a "step away from soccer for my mental health" one day before her club, Angel City, begin their NWSL campaign.

title: Making sense of QB moves in NFL free agency: We ranked the 10 best fits and answered big questions
content: Sam Darnold to Seattle. Geno Smith to Las Vegas. Aaron Rodgers to ...? Our experts sort through quarterback signings, trades and extensions.

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: We're following every NFL free agency move, with updates on Ja'Marr Chase, Tee Higgins and Cooper Rush.

title: Josh  Berry gets first career Cup Series win at Vegas
content: Josh Berry raced to the first Cup Series victory of his career, taking NASCAR's oldest team to victory lane Sunday at Las Vegas Motor Speedway.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: The wait is over: Newcastle beat Liverpool to end 70-year domestic trophy drought
content: Newcastle United have won the Carabao Cup, their first major trophy in over half a century, beating Liverpool at the end of a woeful week for the Reds.

title: European soccer review: England's race for Champions League places is chaos
content: The races at the top and bottom of the Premier League are largely over, but in the middle? That's wide open. That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Arsenal beat Chelsea in derby of flawed teams falling short of ambitions
content: This game took place while a final was happening across town. Neither side will likely reach its goals this season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea keeping tabs on Thuram
content: Chelsea and Arsenal have joined the race for Inter Milan star Marcus Thuram. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: CCTV Footage Shows Vadodara Accused Was Not Driving. Then This Happened
content: Rakshit Chaurasia, the accused in the Vadodara crash that left a woman dead and seven others injured, may have insisted that he would drive the car and convinced his friend Pranshu to shift to the seat next to the driver, CCTV footage shows

title: "Almost Irrelevant": PM Modi Slams UN, International Organisations On Podcast
content: Amid the raging global tensions, PM Modi reflected on the lessons from Covid-19, which exposed the limitations of every nation and underscored the need for unity.

title: "Driver Looked Drunk, Fine Is Not Solution": Man Injured In Vadodara Crash
content: Days after a woman died and several others were injured in a car crash in Vadodara, one of the injured men has claimed that the accused looked "intoxicated" and was speeding for "enjoyment".

title: Sunita Williams' Homecoming Date Confirmed, Will Splash Down Off US Coast
content: Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore are to be transported home with another American astronaut and a Russian cosmonaut aboard a SpaceX Crew Dragon craft.

title: Baloch Rebels Release Video Of Attack On Pak Military Convoy That Killed 5
content: The police said evidence from the site of the Balochistan attack suggested that a suicide attacker rammed an explosive-laden vehicle into the Pakistani paramilitary convoy.

title: "India Better Or Pakistan?" PM Modi Settles Cricket Debate
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave an excellent response when asked to pick the better cricket team between India and Pakistan.

title: HAL Loses Rs 55 Lakh After Payment For Fighter Jet Parts To 'Fake' Company
content: The email was fake, but the money was real. Hindustan Aeronautics Limited or HAL lost $63,000 or Rs 55 lakh to an online scam.

title: "Dystopian Nightmare": Indian Who Self-Deported From US After Visa Revocation
content: The US Department of State had cancelled Ranjani Srinivasan's visa on March 5, citing security concerns related to her involvement in alleged activities "supporting Hamas".

title: 'Dark Oxygen': A Deep-Sea Discovery That Has Split Scientists
content: Could lumpy metallic rocks in the deepest, darkest reaches of the ocean be making oxygen in the absence of sunlight?

title: Mumbai Indians Star Breaches Pak Contract To Join IPL, Gets Legal Notice
content: The PCB management has also outlined the repercussions of his departure from the league and expects his response within the stipulated time frame.

title: Over 400 Guests Evacuated As Fire Erupts At Australia's Hilton Hotel
content: Upon arrival, firefighters discovered a blaze on the roof, with burning debris falling and igniting a second fire on the hotel's lower level.

title: Patels Were Out For Treat. Vadodara Crash Left Woman Dead, Husband Critical
content: It was the evening before Holi. Hemali Patel, 35, and Purav Patel, 40, were out with their daughter after Holika Dahan to buy colours and grab something to eat. They were on a scooter, riding through Vadodara's streets and planning the Holi bash

title: All About Joshua Riibe, Man Last Seen With Missing Indian-American Student
content: Sudiksha Konanki, a 20-year-old Indian-origin student in the US, vanished while on a spring break trip to Punta Cana, Dominican Republic.

title: India Masters Beat WI Masters To Clinch Inaugural International Masters League
content: India Masters vs West Indies Masters Highlights, IML 2025 Final: India Masters eased past West Indies Masters by 6 wickets in the final to clinch inaugural International Masters League.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hunted Down, Massacred, Syria's Alawites Ask India For Help
content: Ali Koshmr, a 36-year-old man from Syria's Latakia, around 330 km from Damascus, woke up to the sounds of gunfire, tires screeching and dozens of armed men shouting, "Come out, you Alawite pigs, Nusayris!"

title: The women’s March Madness bracket is here -- so is your guide to all 68 teams
content: the bracket is set, and 68 teams are going dancing in the women's NCAA tournament . defending champion south Carolina to first-timer George Mason are in the bracket . there's no clear-cut favorite -- a fitting end to this riveting season full of star power .

title: Let the fun begin: Make your picks for the women's tournament
content: Welcome back to the #1 Women's Bracket game! The tourney tips off Friday, 3/21 @ 11:30a ET - don't get locked out, create your brackets today! Be sure to create a group and invite your friends to share in the madness.

title: What do the first two rounds of a perfect draft look like?
content: fantasy baseball managers all over the world are getting ready for those ever-crucial drafts . they say practice makes perfect -- and you can certainly practice your drafting skills in our Mock Draft Lobby . Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell weighed in on each of their ideal picks from each of the 10 draft positions in an ESPN standard league .

title: At US airports, elderly green card holders face pressure to give it up
content: Immigration attorneys report an increase in the secondary inspection and detention of green card holders by the US Custom and Border Protection (CBP), particularly targeting elderly Indian residents. Attorneys advise against surrendering green cards at the airport, stressing the importance of a hearing before an immigration judge.

title: Amritsar temple attack: Key assailant killed in police encounter, one escapes
content: One of the assailants involved in the attack on Thakurdwara temple in Amritsar was killed during an encounter with Punjab police. The attack on the temple resulted in significant damage but no fatalities. The deceased was identified as Gursidak Singh, and his accomplice Vishal escaped. The police continue to pursue the remaining suspect.

title: The reason behind Lex Fridman’s 45-hour fast before his podcast with PM Modi
content: During the interview, PM Modi discussed the significance of fasting in Indian culture, its spiritual and scientific aspects, and how it enhances sensory perception and discipline. The conversation also touched on PM Modi's vision for the nation.

title: TN BJP chief Annamalai, ex-governor Tamilisai Soundararajan arrested in Chennai
content: BJP state president K Annamalai was arrested by Chennai police while heading to Egmore for a protest against the TASMAC scam. Former Governor Tamilisai Soundararajan and other senior party leaders were also detained. Police blocked the residences of BJP state and district office-bearers from 7 am onwards, arresting them as soon as they attempted to leave for the protest.

title: Explained: Player replacement rules in IPL 2025
content: The IPL has expanded its player replacement policy, allowing teams to replace players facing season-ending injuries or illnesses till the season's 12th league fixture. Here's an explainer on what the rule specifically says.

title: When Indian Babu beat Facebook CEO and others in his team by a simple 'Jugaad'
content: In 2016, an Indian official thwarted Facebook's campaign to save Free Basics by simply opting out of automated emails, according to Sarah Wynn-Williams' memoir. The book alleges Facebook's use of technological and political influence to sway public opinion in India, which ultimately failed as the program was banned for violating net neutrality.

title: Inspired by shows, Gwalior man fakes road crash after killing wife to mislead cops
content: A man in Gwalior district killed his wife and staged her death as a road accident. Initial suspicions of foul play were confirmed by forensic and postmortem reports, which led to the husband's arrest. He and his family had been harassing the wife for dowry before her murder.

title: Sunita Williams’ joyful photos go viral as she returns after 9 months in Space
content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams are returning to Earth after a nine-month mission, extended due to spacecraft issues. Their return became possible with the docking of the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft. Videos of Williams joyfully greeting the Crew-10 team have gone viral. The ISS currently hosts 11 members, with Crew-9 soon to return.

title: Meet Shark Tank India’s new judge Srikanth Bolla: Know his inspirational story
content: Srikanth Bolla, founder of Bollant Industries, has joined the 'Shark Tank India' judges panel. Despite being visually impaired, he has achieved significant success, including becoming the first sight-impaired student at MIT's Sloan School. Bolla's company employs over 500 people, and his inspiring journey is captured in a biopic starring Rajkummar Rao.

title: Rape accused shot at while trying to escape from police custody in UP
content: Aman Putra Chand Khan, accused of raping a seven-year-old girl, attempted to escape police custody in Hathras, Uttar Pradesh by snatching a policeman's pistol and firing at the police. The police retaliated, injuring him in the leg, and he was subsequently recaptured and taken to the hospital for treatment before facing legal procedures.

title: Norris' narrow Australian GP win over Verstappen belies McLaren dominance
content: Lando Norris wins the first race of the season in Melbourne . the 0.8-second winning margin over Max Verstappen belied the performance of his McLaren MCL39 . norris' old friend and persistent foe was tucked right under his rear wing .

title: Dissecting the Eastern wild-card race
content: each of the teams in the Eastern Conference playoff mix has 15 to 17 games remaining in the regular season . a current three-game winning streak certainly helps the New Jersey Devils . the Columbus Blue Jackets technically are in the second wild-card spot thanks to getting to 70 points in fewer games played (65) than the New York Rangers (66).

title: More pain for Atleti as Barça strike pivotal LaLiga title blow
content: a 92nd-minute strike from Ferran Torres puts atlético ahead in the 45th minute . the result catapults Barcelona to the top of the laLiga table on 60 points . atletico are four points behind the pair .

title: Women's bracket winners, losers and the path ahead for JuJu Watkins and Paige Bueckers﻿
content: the Bruins have reached the 30-win mark for the first time in program history . they are hoping to make their first final four in the NCAA era . the top seeds are split between the Big Ten and the SEC .

title: Fernandes central to Man United's much-needed win at Leicester
content: man united climbed to 13th in the premier league after 3-0 win against Leicester City . a hat trick from ayden Heaven was a big boost for manager Ruben Amorim . click here for all the latest man united news .

title: Trump’s golden touch: How Oval Office became a gilded palace
content: US President Donald Trump has transformed the traditionally minimalistic Oval Office into a space filled with gold accents, grand portraits, and memorabilia from his Mar-a-Lago estate. His additions include replacing the Resolute Desk temporarily and planning for significant estate-style renovations to the White House grounds.

title: Indian-origin CEO of AI startup has message for students on deportation
content: Rishi Kumar, CEO of EthosAI, supports the deportation of Ranjani Srinivasan, a Columbia PhD student who fled to Canada after her visa was revoked for alleged support of Hamas. Kumar emphasized that international students must be cautious about their actions and speech, as visa privileges can be revoked.

title: Ahmedabad event manager assaulted, mocked over her height
content: A 25-year-old woman from Ahmedabad filed a complaint against a man who insulted her height and hit her during an argument. The incident occurred while she was with friends. Police registered a case under Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita Section 74, involving assault with intent to outrage modesty, following her father's advice to file the complaint.

title: A hive outside? Bee calm and get going
content: In Bengaluru, the blooming season leads to increased bee activity and hive formation in urban areas. Residents and conservationists are promoting safe relocation over extermination to protect these vital pollinators and preserve biodiversity. Efforts include community education and advocating for humane hive removal practices.

title: Will Sunita Williams be paid extra for her extended stay in space? Here’s the NASA pay breakdown for her 9-month stay
content: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams were on an extended nine-month mission aboard the ISS due to technical issues. Despite the prolonged stay, their compensation remains standard as federal employees, earning approximately $94,998 to $123,152 for the mission. They continue to contribute to scientific research, awaiting return on the SpaceX Dragon capsule.

title: Watch: Baloch rebels release footage of attack on Pakistani military convoy
content: The Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) has released visuals of their attack on a Pakistani military convoy in Noshki, Balochistan. The BLA claims 90 army personnel were killed, while Pakistani authorities report five paramilitary troops dead. The ambush involved a vehicle-borne improvised explosive device targeting a convoy of eight buses.

title: 'Cops manning emperor's tomb': Maharashtra alert over stir to raze Aurangzeb mausoleum
content: Police have heightened security at the tomb of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb near Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar after threats from right-wing groups wanting its demolition. Access to the tomb has been limited, with SRPF deployed and barricades set up nearby. Politicians from opposing factions are using the situation for political leverage.

title: 'Hypo(d)crisy ki koi seema nahi hai': Congress on PM Modi's podcast with Lex Fridman
content: Congress criticised PM Modi for his podcast with Lex Fridman, accusing him of avoiding press conferences and attacking critics while claiming that 'criticism is the soul of democracy.' Modi discussed his influence from RSS, his stance on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, and his relationship with Donald Trump, aligning 'America First' with 'India First.'

title: Trump declares war on 'sleepy' Biden's pardons: 'Void, vacant...'
content: President Trump has declared that presidential pardons issued by Joe Biden are invalid, claiming they were signed with an autopen without Biden's knowledge. Trump suggested potential legal scrutiny for members of the January 6th committee, alleging they destroyed evidence and used the autopen for pardons without Biden's consent.

title: MS Dhoni recalls 'big mistake' during IPL which 'triggered' him
content: Former Indian cricketer MS Dhoni recounted his infamous outburst during the 2019 IPL when a no-ball controversy led him to confront umpires on the field, resulting in a fine. Dhoni acknowledged his mistake while mentioning such incidents stem from the high stakes of the sport. He will play for CSK in IPL 2025, aiming to surpass Suresh Raina’s run record for the franchise.

title: 'Russia stole almost another week': Zelenskyy on delayed ceasefire
content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy accused Russia of prolonging the war despite ceasefire proposals and diplomatic efforts. He emphasized Ukraine's commitment to its defense and criticized Russian President Putin’s stance on the ceasefire as manipulative. Zelenskyy highlighted the importance of supporting Ukraine’s armed forces and condemned Russia for complicating the ceasefire process.

title: 'Will name ministers linked to Ranya Rao gold smuggling case': BJP MLA
content: BJP MLA Basangouda Patil Yatnal has vowed to reveal the names of ministers involved in a gold smuggling case associated with Kannada actress Ranya Rao. Rao, arrested with 14.8 kg of gold, is suspected of being part of a broader smuggling network. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Goods train hits girder, disrupts traffic in Andhra Pradesh's Anakapalli
content: Multiple trains on the Vijayawada-Visakhapatnam route experienced delays due to a damaged bridge near Anakapalli district caused by an unknown lorry. Quick action by railway officials averted a potential mishap, and services were restored by 9:05 am.

title: Bumps at Auli: 3rd year in a row, national ski championship postponed
content: The annual skiing and snowboarding championship in Auli, scheduled for March 16-19, has been postponed for the third year due to inadequate snowfall. Despite preparations, the lack of sufficient snow depth on the slopes led to this decision. The event was initially set for January but was delayed in hopes of better snowfall, which didn’t occur.

title: Priest ends life, asks son in suicide note to ‘save temple’ in Ahmedabad
content: A priest, Mahendra Minekar, committed suicide at a temple in Kubernagar, Ahmedabad, allegedly due to the mental torture from authorities and developers over plans to demolish the temple established by his grandfather. Police are investigating the allegations, despite officials denying any demolition plans and asserting that the temple would remain intact during redevelopment.

title: US govt deports migrants despite judge’s order
content: In an escalating clash between the US executive branch and judiciary, Judge James Boasberg blocked President Trump's use of the 1798 Alien Enemies Act to deport Venezuelan gang members, including turning around flights already in the air. The Trump administration, challenging the ruling, claims it prioritizes public safety.

title: Thank you Dhoni for getting me back to CSK: Ashwin
content: Ravichandran Ashwin reflects on his return to Chennai Super Kings (CSK) after a decade, noting the team's unchanged cricket-oriented nature despite the evolving corporatisation of the IPL. Ashwin, eager to enjoy cricket again, appreciates the familiar atmosphere and values the iconic bond with MS Dhoni.

title: 'Second time in 24 hrs': Iran-backed Houthis claim another attack on US ships
content: Iran-backed Houthi rebels in Yemen claimed a second attack on the USS Harry S Truman and its warships within 24 hours. This retaliation followed US airstrikes that targeted Houthi positions in Yemen, resulting in at least 53 rebel deaths and over 100 injuries.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens over 300 points up; Nifty50 above 22,500
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While BSE Sensex was above 74,100, Nifty50 was above 22,500.

title: India to step on the gas for indigenous 5th gen stealth fighter jet
content: India is accelerating the development of its fifth-generation stealth fighter jet, AMCA, to counter emerging threats from Pakistan and China. A top-level committee is working on strategies to improve efficiency and shorten production timelines, with a focus on greater private sector involvement.

title: Sunita Williams' return to Earth moved up a day, set for Tuesday
content: Two astronauts, Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, are set to return to Earth on Tuesday evening after an unexpected nine-month stay on the ISS. NASA and SpaceX have revised the splashdown timing due to favorable conditions, allowing their return alongside another American astronaut and a Russian cosmonaut.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for this week
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal recommends HPCL and Varun Beverages as top stock picks. HPCL's strong refining margins and marketing volumes boost earnings, while Varun Beverages has seen significant revenue growth and expanded market penetration.

title: WATCH: Yuvraj, Best clash as tempers flare; Lara steps in
content: Sachin Tendulkar's India Masters clinched the International Masters League 2025 title by defeating West Indies Masters in Raipur. The match saw a heated exchange between Yuvraj Singh and Tino Best, requiring Brian Lara's intervention. Despite the tension, India comfortably chased 149 with Ambati Rayudu's 74-run contribution and Sachin's vintage performance, sealing victory with six wickets.

title: India, New Zealand to restart FTA talks after a 10-year gap
content: India and New Zealand have restarted discussions for a Free Trade Agreement after a 10-year hiatus. This new move aims to deepen economic ties and address market access issues to achieve balanced outcomes, as bilateral trade surpasses $1 billion.

title: China's rise hampers India's effort to be leader of Global South: Army Chief
content: "The rise of China as a dominant economic and strategic force adds complexity, creates competition, and hampers India's effort to be the natural leader for the Global South," Gen Dwivedi said while speaking at the fourth General Bipin Rawat Memorial Lecture in Delhi.

title: Govt may return land acquired for national highway if not used for 5 years
content: Land acquired for highway development will be returned to original owners if unused for five years, and objections to compensation are limited to three months post-announcement. The amendments to the National Highways Act aim to speed up land acquisition and reduce disputes, with a focus on transparency.

title: 'Alien' greets Nasa astronauts Sunita and Butch as they await return to Earth
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, stranded for nine months at the ISS, were greeted by an 'alien' during the arrival of the SpaceX crew. The friendly welcoming came as they prepared for their imminent return to Earth. Their extended stay was due to technical issues with their Boeing Starliner.

title: What Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore might experience after reaching earth
content: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore face significant physiological and psychological challenges upon returning from microgravity. They may experience muscle atrophy, bone loss, dizziness, and vision problems. Rehabilitation and NASA's support systems help them readapt to Earth's gravity and daily routines. The journey of adjustment after space travel is crucial for their recovery.

title: 3 workers killed in drunken brawl in Bengaluru over abusive remarks
content: Three Bihar labourers aged between 18 and 20 were killed, and another was injured in a brawl initiated by inappropriate comments about a sister of one of the attackers at a Bengaluru construction site. The suspects, Sonu and Sudheer, both from Gopalganj, are being sought by police.

title: March Madness: Facts to help you fill out your men's bracket
content: March Madness brings sports fans together unlike any other event in this country . sign up now to play the #1 men's bracket game for FREE! $135,000 in prizes . all stats referenced are since 1985 (also called the "modern era" throughout the column)

title: Sacred Trails: Telangana tourists flock to Madhya Pradesh’s temples and heritage sites
content: Given the varied demands of tourists, we are focusing on customised packages, designed on basis of — number of tourists, duration of stay, times of visit and mode of transport — we can assure visitors of affordable accommodations at our hotels and resorts, explains an official of the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Board

title: ASHA workers lay siege to Secretariat in Kerala, steps up agitation
content: Life came to a standstill along arterial MG Road in Kerala capital as thousands of ASHAs from all over the State blockaded the front gate of Secretariat

title: Munambam judicial commission’s appointment cancellation plunges land issue into further legal complications
content: Though the State government, represented by its Advocate General, keenly contested the petition of the Kerala Waqf Land Samrakshana Vedi for the dissolution of Mr. Nair’s appointment before the Kerala High Court, the court found merit in the contentions of Vedi and ruled in its favour

title: Influencer Orry, 7 others booked for ‘consuming alcohol’ at J&K’s Vaishno Devi pilgrimage base camp
content: The FIR was registered against the eight for “violating the law of the land” and a team was set up to nab them for “hurting the sentiments of people”

title: Modi speaking Trump's language: Congress on PM's remarks on global organisations
content: He also addressed the relevance of global organisations like the United Nations, noting that their inability to evolve with the times has sparked a global debate on their relevance

title: 1,343 cases registered in Kerala CSR funds scam, says CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Responding to questions, Pinarayi tells Kerala Assembly that accused collected ₹281.43 crore from 49,386 people

title: Control rooms and helpline centres opened in Yadgir to attend to drinking water crisis in the district
content: Zilla panchayat CEO has directed the nodal officers and officers deployed at helpline centres not to avoid a single call on water crises

title: Accused looked ‘intoxicated’, was overspeeding for ‘enjoyment,’ says victim of Vadodara car accident
content: Vikas Kewalani, the victim of the car accident, demanded strict actions against the accused, stating that they will realise their mistakes only when strict punishment is taken against them

title: Munambam land issue: Kerala High Court quashes appointment of Ramachandran Nair commission
content: Court observes that as the issue is still pending before Waqf Tribunal, even if the dispute creates any issues of public order, recourse to Provisions of the Commission of Inquiry Act could not have been resorted to at this stage

title: Security forces seize firearms in Manipur's Bishnupur
content: Police also said that intelligence-based combing operations and cordon and search operations are being carried out in both hill and valley districts to recover all the looted and illegal weapons in the State

title: Tamil Nadu BJP leaders, including Annamalai and Tamilisai, arrested ahead of protest at Tasmac headquarters
content: Tamil Nadu BJP chief Annamalai was taken into custody near Neelangarai as he was proceeding towards the protest venue in Egmore

title: Maharana Pratap descendant Arvind Singh Mewar dies at 81
content: He is survived by wife Vijayraj Kumari, son Lakshyaraj Singh Mewar and daughters Bhargavi Kumari Mewar and Padmaja Kumari Parmar.

title: Amritsar temple blast suspect killed in exchange of fire with Punjab Police
content: The blast occurred outside the Thakur Dwara Temple on March 15 when a person hurled an explosive device towards it, damaging a portion of its wall and shattering window panes

title: Gold worth ₹8.47 crore seized at Mumbai airport; three staffers among five held
content: “The seizures were made between March 13-15 and some of the accused had concealed the precious metal in their clothes and undergarments,” officials said

title: Justice Bagchi sworn in as SC judge, in line to be CJI in 2031
content: Justice Bagchi would take over the office of the CJI in May 2031 and continue till his retirement on October 2, 2031

title: Is government ready to discuss voter ID issue, asks Trinamool’s Derek O’Brien as Parliament resumes after break
content: "Parliament gets back to work after a four day break. A constructive Opposition wants to debate an issue that is at the core of democracy. Is the Government ready?" Derek O'Brien said

title: Construction of road on Bhima bridge completed
content: In another major repair work to reconstruct the shoulder part of the railway bridge, which is adjacent to the Bhima river bridge, was also completed at a cost of ₹ 1 crore

title: Police arrests student for namaz in open area of university in Meerut
content: The student was arrested following protests by local Hindu groups over a purported video surfaced around Holi celebrations this week that showed a group of students offering namaz on the university campus

title: Palaniswami seeks solatium for man, who died while waiting for darshan ticket in Tiruchendur temple
content: Criticising the government, he alleged inaction on the part of Minister for Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments for the man’s death

title: Cheetah, four cubs to be released into wild in M.P.'s Kuno National Park
content: After the release of Gamini and her four cubs, the number of cheetahs in the wild in KNP will rise to 17, while nine will stay in the enclosures

title: Aja Sarma calls upon employees not to opt for United Pension Scheme
content: Forum for Development of North Andhra general secretary warns against New Pension Scheme and Unified Pension Scheme as alternatives to Old Pension Scheme at seminar

title: Commuters, bus operators irked over poor condition of Fort Kochi bus stand
content: Bus operators too are peeved at the condition of the bus stand that was constructed just over 15 years ago and is now used mostly to park buses

title: Tamil Nadu to net about ₹3,450 crore through Mineral Bearing Land Tax law
content: In the light of the Supreme Court’s verdict last year, the government has framed the Mineral Bearing Land Tax Act, which received the assent of Governor R.N. Ravi on February 20, 2025.

title: AIADMK leaders should shed ego to return to power in 2026: OPS
content: The AIADMK was formed on the strong support of the masses. The party created history by implementing a large number of welfare schemes for all sections of society. Such a political party now remains divided. This should end, says O. Panneerselvam

title: PM Modi hails Election Commission, says global community should study its working
content: Out of 980 million registered voters, 646 million stepped out of their homes to vote, even in the extreme heat of May when temperatures in some places reached 40 degrees Celsius, says Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Rampant encroachments on footpaths, roads pose a safety threat to pedestrians
content: Stakeholders express concern over the increasing number of encroachments by shops and kiosks in the city at a meeting of Kanayannur Taluk Vikasana Samithi; problem is acute at Kaloor, Kathrikadavu, Pullepady, Thammanam, and Pallimukku; Mayor promises action based on HC directive

title: No limit to hypo(d)crisy: Congress's play on words slamming PM over his podcast
content: He who is afraid of facing the media in a press conference has found comfort in a foreign podcaster anchored in the rightwing ecosystem, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Opposition leaders compare BJP governance in Maharashtra to that of Aurangzeb’s rule
content: Ruling BJP terms statements by Congress and Shiv Sena (UBT) leaders as ‘childish and irresponsible’ meant to ‘tarnish’ the culture of Maharashtra

title: Peace not paying for Mizoram, says Chief Minister Lalduhoma
content: The State deserves a peace bonus if not security-related expenditure the other States are getting, he tells Home Minister Amit Shah in Guwahati

title: Mother tongue is our identity and it has to be protected, says A.P. Legislative Assembly Deputy Speaker Raghu Ramakrishna Raju
content: The State governments should provide opportunities for Telugu people to study in their mother tongue, he says

title: BJP under Vijayendra has failed to fight Congress effectively on Muslim appeasement, says Yatnal
content: He also expresses dissatisfaction over the appointment of the Vijayapura district unit president of the party

title: In a relief to booksellers, Centre to align Book Post tariff with earlier subsidised Book Packet rates
content: With the new Post Office Act, 2023, coming into effect, Book Packet, the much preferred service to send books by publishers and small magazines was scrapped, and instead booksellers had to opt for the Book Post service, which was costlier

title: What is Elon Musk’s Starlink all about? | Explained
content: What is Starlink, and how does it work? Why does it face regulatory hurdles in India? Why hasn’t India auctioned satellite spectrum? What impact could U.S. trade pressure have on Starlink’s approval? What government approvals does Starlink need?

title: Amid global uncertainties, spy chiefs from across world converge in Delhi
content: Counterterrorism, Intelligence-sharing mechanisms and extradition were among a host of issues discussed at the conference, which is held a day before the Raisina Dialogue

title: BJP turning India into ‘a Hindu Pakistan’, Sanjay Raut says in Saamana
content: ‘This country survived because people like Pandit Nehru did not allow it to become a Hindu Pakistan, but during the Modi era, the country is being pushed towards a new Partition,’ Sanjay Raut wrote in an editorial in the Shiv Sena (UBT) mouthpiece

title: A school that made childhood an experience to cherish
content: PS Higher Secondary School alumni say teachers did not put pressure on them to study to become achievers

title: 262 villages in Kalaburagi district may face water scarcity during summer
content: A comprehensive plan has been prepared to tackle drinking water shortage by reviving dried borewells and piped supply

title: Bengal BJP begins search for new State president
content: On Friday, the State unit of the BJP released a list of 25 organisational district presidents. There are 17 new faces with several MLAs having been removed from the post of district president

title: Congress targets govt. over air quality report ranking India as fifth most polluted country
content: Jairam Ramesh seeks roll back of ‘anti-people’ environment law amendments over past 10 years; he asks Centre to revamp norms, increase funds

title: Sikh radical MP Amritpal’s aides to face trial in Punjab
content: The seven key aides of the jailed MP are lodged in the Dibrugarh jail in Assam under the National Security Act

title: 11 arrested in M.P. over ‘murder’ of police officer; CM announces ₹1 crore ex gratia for ASI’s kin
content: It is alleged that the Assistant Sub-Inspector was attacked by tribals, who had allegedly abducted a man, while a police team went to rescue him. State Congress chief says the tribals retaliated as the police committed atrocities on them.

title: False narrative created over 2002 Gujarat riots, courts found us innocent: PM
content: Modi says the perception that the 2002 riots were the biggest riots ever in Gujarat was an attempt to push misinformation

title: Kedarnath MLA demands ban on ‘non-Hindus’ from Char Dham Yatra region
content: Sources say local businessmen had complained about sales of non-vegetarian food and liquor on the route of the Kedarnath temple

title: ‘ரூ’ made into big news by those who dislike Tamil: Stalin
content: In a video clip of the Ungalil Oruvan Q&A posted on his social media handle, he says that the alphabet was incorporated to show how assertive they are in their language policy

title: Mumbai Economic Offences Wing arrests two more accused persons in New India Co-operative Bank fraud case
content: ‘It is alleged that Arunachalam Ullahanathan Maruthuvar received approximately ₹30 crore from the misappropriated funds of NICB from the main accused Hitesh Mehta,’ officials said

title: Transport unions urge Govt. to revise prices of tracking devices, panic buttons
content: The unions argue that the steep costs, coupled with a lack of awareness, have made it challenging for many vehicle owners to comply with the mandate

title: Osmania University bans protests in academic, admin spaces; students call bandh
content: It advised that registered students with grievances first approach the officials concerned at the institution level and then represent to the Registrar and other authorities with prior permission

title: Devotees of Rettamalai Temple suffer in the absence of a good road
content: The temple attracts more than 2,000 devotees, most whom visit the temple to offer special puja, and travel by cars, vans, and two-wheelers.

title: Woman's Post On Uber Pets' Charging 5 Times The Normal Ride Sparks Debate
content: a Gurugram woman claims that Uber Pets costs five times more than a regular ride . Anya Rao says she discovered the new pet-friendly travel option when making a taxi reservation . she questioned whether the service was actually affordable or only an upscale luxury .
